intro: Corynelobos baeticus, commonly known as the Iberian heath, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its small, leathery leaves. The plant produces white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands and rocky habitats. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in some regions.
